intro: Helophytum reflexum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, white or yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round seeds. Helophytum reflexum is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its hardiness and ornamental appeal.
